title: Dominant Morrow puts LSU in 3rd straight Elite 8
content: With Flau'Jae Johnson struggling, Aneesah Morrow carried the load with 30 points and 19 rebounds as LSU topped NC State 80-73 for its third straight Elite Eight appearance.

title: Gottlieb defends MSU: JuJu not hurt on dirty play
content: USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb condemned the online bullying against Mississippi State's Chandler Prater, saying she did not believe JuJu Watkins' ACL tear was the result of a dirty play.

title: Dodgers show off ring bling, keep title party going
content: After raising their championship banner, the Dodgers kept the party going by showing off their World Series rings that contain 14-karat yellow gold, diamonds and sapphires.

title: Geno: Idea for two-host system 'ruined the game'
content: UConn coach Geno Auriemma reiterated his disdain for the two-host regional system for the women's NCAA tournament, saying "whoever came up with this super regional stuff -- and I know who they are -- ruined the game."

title: Vols stifle UK, one step from first Final Four trip
content: Tennessee outplayed Kentucky on both ends of the court in a 78-65 victory that sent the Volunteers to a second consecutive Elite Eight of the NCAA tournament.

title: Ravens, Harbaugh reach extension through '28
content: John Harbaugh, the Ravens' all-time winningest coach, has agreed to a three-year extension with the team through the 2028 season. He was entering the final year of his deal.

title: Liu ends U.S. drought, wins figure skating worlds
content: Alysa Liu dethroned three-time defending champion Kaori Sakamoto to become the first American women's figure skating world champion since 2006.

title: UCLA lands MWC player of year Dent from portal
content: Guard Donovan Dent, who averaged 20.4 points and 6.5 assists for New Mexico this season, has committed to UCLA after entering the transfer portal.

title: Braden Smith's long road to Big Ten basketball, the Purdue record books and another Sweet 16
content: It took an unlikely chain of events to get Braden Smith to Purdue, but he hasn't looked back since arriving.

title: Day 1 of the men's Sweet 16: High-scoring games, OT, more
content: The first half of the Elite Eight has been set. Catchup on (or relive) the action from Thursday's four games.

title: Inside the unprecedented transformation of Steinbrenner Field
content: The Yankees' spring training facility became the Rays' Opening Day ballpark in just four days. Here's how.

title: Six theories on why penalties (and power plays) are dramatically down this NHL season
content: Are players playing cleaner? Are referees swallowing their whistles? Players, execs, and analysts offer ideas.

title: NHL Power Rankings: Latest updated poll, plus each team's strength of schedule
content: As the playoff field solidifies, here's how our panel voted, along with each team's slate through April 17.

title: Inside Elic Ayomanor's viral night and journey from Canada to the NFL draft
content: From Medicine Hat, Alberta, the Stanford receiver came along way to a record night against Travis Hunter and his NFL future.

title: Olympic champ Chloe Kim has a new outlook, new tricks -- and the old dominance
content: After struggling with depression, the snowboarder has found her joy again as she looks to qualify for the 2026 Olympics Saturday at Worlds.

title: Robinson's rise has Fulham dreaming of Europe and the U.S. a World Cup
content: In a breakout season, Fulham's Antonee Robinson has emerged as one of the best left backs in the world, and he's dreaming of big things with the U.S.

title: Helen Hu's unexpected path back to NCAA gymnastics
content: A year ago, Helen Hu was retired from gymnastics and working at a hostel in Ecuador. This past weekend, she won the SEC beam title.

title: Dani Alves sexual assault conviction overturned
content: The top court in Spain's Catalonia region said Friday it had overturned the conviction of Brazilian soccer player Dani Alves for sexual assault.

title: U.S.'s Cardoso feels 'valued' by Tottenham links
content: Transfer speculation to the Premier League is giving Real Betis midfielder Johnny Cardoso confidence, according to the United States international.

title: Sources: Griezmann staying put amid LAFC links
content: Antoine Griezmann is likely to stay at Atlético Madrid next season, sources have told ESPN, despite his longstanding interest in playing in MLS.

title: Bayern threaten to sue Canada over Davies injury
content: Bayern Munich said they are considering legal action against the Canadian soccer federation following Alphonso Davies' serious knee injury.

title: Chelsea captain Bright warns Barça: 'Bring it on'
content: Chelsea captain Millie Bright has hailed her side's 'unbelievable mentality' and embraced the challenge of facing Barcelona in the UWCL semifinals.

title: Barça vent anger over schedule as Olmo injured
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said his team paid a "high price" for beating Osasuna 3-0 after losing Dani Olmo to injury in a game they were forced to play on Thursday.

title: UEFA to investigate Mbappé, Vini over Atleti game
content: Four Real Madrid players, including Kylian Mbappé and Vinícius Júnior, are being investigated for alleged "indecent conduct" during the Champions League game at Atlético Madrid, UEFA said on Thursday.

title: Source: PSG owners finalizing Málaga purchase
content: Qatar Sport Investment (QSI), the owner of Paris Saint-Germain, are finalising the purchase of the Spanish club Malaga, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Barca, Madrid ... or Atletico -- who wins LaLiga?
content: LaLiga returns with Atleti, Barça and Madrid all after the title. ESPN's Alex Kirkland, Sam Marsden, Sid Lowe, Graham Hunter answer the key questions.

title: Breaking down the Premier League run-in, UCL race
content: A season that has defied expectations looks set for a thrilling contest for Champions League qualification.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Leipzig want Jobe Bellingham amid links to Chelsea and others
content: RB Leipzig join the race for Jobe Bellingham amid links to Chelsea, Man United and others. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Mikaela Mayer's jab, movement vs. Sandy Ryan's power
content: A boxing insider and a former opponent share their predictions for the Mikaela Mayer vs. Sandy Ryan rematch.

title: What the numbers tell us about Mayer vs. Ryan and Zepeda vs. Farmer
content: Two rematches on Saturday, one in Las Vegas, one in Mexico -- here's a look at the fights through the numbers.

title: Powerful Earthquakes Leave Nearly 700 Dead In Myanmar, Thailand
content: At least 694 people were killed and 1,670 injured after six earthquakes - the biggest of7.7 magnitude- hit near Sagaing in central Myanmar at 12.50pm (local time) Friday.

title: Myanmar Earthquake Live: 694 Killed, Over 1,600 injured
content: Myanmar, Thailand Earthquake Live Updates: The death count from a massive earthquake in Myanmar has jumped to 694, with 1,670 people injured, the country's ruling junta said Saturday.

title: "You Know PM Modi Was...": Donald Trump Replies To India Tariff Question
content: Trump had earlier said that India was a very high-tariff nation and reciprocal tariffs on countries that impose levies on American goods would kick in on April 2.

title: Elon Musk Sells Social Media Platform X To His xAI Startup For $33 Billion
content: Elon Musk said on Friday that his artificial intelligence startup xAI is buying his social networking platform X in a deal that valued the company, once known as Twitter, at $33 billion.

title: India Sends 15 Tonnes Of Relief Material To Earthquake-Hit Myanmar
content: The relief material includes tents, sleeping bags, blankets, ready-to-eat meals, water purifiers, hygiene kits, solar lamps, generator sets and essential medicines.

title: Elderly Couple Loses Rs 50 Lakh To Cyber Fraud In Karnataka, Dies By Suicide
content: An elderly couple in Khanapur taluk, Belagavi district, died by suicide after falling victim to cyber fraud and alleged harassment, police said on Friday.

title: 10,000 Indians Jailed Abroad Freed In A Decade - How Diplomacy Played A Part
content: Going to jail is a nightmarish thought for most people, but being imprisoned in another country can be a hellish experience. Like nationals of many other countries, thousands of Indians too, have been languishing in prisons overseas.

title: Egg Seller, Juice Vendor Get Notices For GST Dues Worth Crores
content: An egg seller and a juice vendor in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh were in for a huge shock when they received notices for dues worth crores from the Income Tax (I-T) department.

title: "It Was Just 50 Runs": Gaikwad's Bizarre Remark After CSK's Big Loss vs RCB
content: Chennai Super Kings captain Ruturaj Gaikwad came up with a bizarre remark following his side's heavy loss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the IPL 2025.

title: Mohanlal's 'Empuraan' Sparks Fresh Congress-BJP Row In Poll-Bound Kerala
content: Kerala's ruling Left front and the main opposition, the Congress, have united to celebrate actor Mohanlal's new movie, 'L2: Empuraan', which they say "exposes the Sangh agenda".

title: Army Officer Charged For Allegedly Raping Cop On Pretext Of Marriage
content: An Army officer has been charged with allegedly raping a female constable of the Madhya Pradesh police posted in Bhopal city on the pretext of marriage in an incident dating back to 2012, police said on Friday.

title: IPL 2025: RCB Breach Chepauk Fortress, Break 17-Year Jinx With Win Over CSK
content: Chennai Super Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Highlights, IPL 2025: This happened to be RCB's second win in Chennai with their first victory coming back in IPL 2008.

title: Pregnant Woman Loses Child As MP Hospital Refuses Admission, Probe Ordered
content: An inquiry was ordered after a pregnant woman in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam district was allegedly turned away twice from a health centre and her newborn died after she delivered hours later while being rushed to the facility on a hand-cart.

title: High Court Grants Fresh Bail To Asaram For 3 Months On Medical Grounds
content: The Gujarat High Court on Friday granted fresh temporary bail for three months to self-styled godman Asaram, who is serving life imprisonment in a rape case, on medical grounds following a split verdict.

title: Women's March Madness Sweet 16: Live analysis, scores and analysis
content: four teams will be one step closer to Tampa, Florida . all four no. 1 seeds have advanced this far, and two will take the court . the Bruins will face Ole Miss , one of three 5-seeds to reach the Sweet 16 .

title: Follow live: Purdue challenging Houston down the stretch for shot at Elite Eight
content: Auburn beat Michigan 78-65 How Auburn won: In the second half, Tahaad Pettiford hit a turnaround jumper after he was fouled . he made a gesture as if he wasn't taking a phone call . his breakout performance against Michigan might have changed his future .

title: 2025 preview: Skip Holtz looks to keep Birmingham on top, Bob Stoops takes aim
content: the Birmingham Stallions beat the San Antonio Brahmas to win the 2024 UFL championship . "that's how we've been able to win," coach Skip Holtz said earlier this month . the stallions have gone 26-4 in the past three regular seasons .

title: Watch: 0.16 seconds! MS Dhoni effects Phil Salt stumping in a flash
content: At age 43, Mahendra Singh Dhoni displayed his extraordinary wicketkeeping prowess during an IPL 2025 match against RCB, executing a lightning-fast stumping that ended Phil Salt's aggressive innings. Dhoni's remarkable reflexes and cricketing intelligence continue to amaze, reinforcing his legendary status in the sport. With every such moment, Dhoni reinforces his legacy as a generational wicketkeeping genius, proving once again that age is just a number.

title: Donald Trump imposes 25% import tariff on car imports; Musk responds
content: US President Donald Trump has announced a 25% tariff on auto imports and parts, which takes effect on April 3. This decision targets foreign-made cars, light trucks, and key auto parts. Elon Musk highlighted that these tariffs would increase the cost of parts in Tesla cars sourced from other countries.

title: Hit on helmet, Virat Kohli does this - WATCH
content: In the IPL 2025 clash against Chennai Super Kings, Virat Kohli was hit on the helmet by a bouncer from Matheesha Pathirana but reassured his well-being with a thumbs-up. Following a mandatory concussion check, Kohli hit a six and a four off consecutive balls. RCB secured a 50-run victory, marking CSK's first home defeat to them in 17 years.

title: Myanmar earthquake: Why quakes strike certain regions more often
content: A powerful 7.7-magnitude earthquake hit near Mandalay, Myanmar, causing extensive damage and reaching Bangkok. The quake, originating from the Sagaing Fault, has resulted in significant fatalities and destruction, with experts predicting aftershocks for months. Myanmar's seismic vulnerability is attributed to its complex fault lines within the Alpide Belt.

title: MS Dhoni at No. 9? Ex-cricketers say it 'didn't make sense'
content: Chennai Super Kings faced a 50-run defeat against Royal Challengers Bangalore at Chepauk, marking their first home loss to RCB in 17 years. Criticism arose over MS Dhoni's delayed arrival at the crease, with experts suggesting this decision impacted CSK’s chances of a successful chase. With back-to-back away wins against defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders and Chennai Super Kings, RCB have made a strong start to their IPL campaign, eyeing their maiden title.

title: 15-hour-plus Raid on Amazon, Flipkart warehouses: Fake ISI mark products seized
content: The Bureau of Indian Standards has conducted extensive raids on Amazon and Flipkart warehouses in Delhi targeting counterfeit and substandard products. Thousands of items, including geysers, food mixers, electrical appliances, and sports footwear lacking proper ISI certification, were seized with an estimated value of Rs 70 lakh.

title: ‘Couldn’t move Maharashtra court’: Kunal Kamra on pre-arrest bail amid joke row
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra has been granted anticipatory bail by the Madras High Court due to threats and fears of arrest over remarks made in a comedy show. The court acknowledged Kamra's inability to seek bail in Maharashtra, given the threats to his life from ruling party members.

title: GT vs MI: Will Hardik return to jeers or cheers today?
content: Gujarat Titans and Mumbai Indians aim to secure their first win of the season as they face off in Ahmedabad. With Hardik Pandya back from suspension, Mumbai receive a much needed boost. Gujarat seek redemption after a narrow loss to Punjab Kings, focusing on improving both their bowling and fielding.

title: Army officer booked for sexually exploiting cop for 13 years on marriage pretext
content: A policewoman in Bhopal accuses a man of 13 years of sexual exploitation under false promises of marriage, leading to legal action. Separately, in Sarojininagar, a man posing as an Army officer on Instagram is arrested for deceiving multiple women out of money and valuables, including a widow.

title: How to create Ghibli-style Portraits without paying for ChatGPT Plus
content: OpenAI's GPT-4o update, which creates Studio Ghibli-style portraits, is currently restricted to paid subscription tiers due to high demand. However, users can still generate Ghibli-inspired art for free using alternatives like Gemini, GrokAI models, and other third-party tools, or by leveraging free trials on premium AI platforms.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Moreno's path to victory over Erceg at UFC Fight Night
content: Brandon Moreno makes his first Octagon appearance of 2025 . the former two-time men's flyweight champion takes on Steve Erceg . moreno, no. 3 in the divisional rankings, lost the title to Alexandre Pantoja in July 2023 .

title: One room, 300 clubs, 80 agencies, 3,500 meetings: Inside soccer's secret transfer space
content: players clubs are most itching to sign from the transferRoom meeting in Berlin . there are owners, general managers, sporting directors and scouts, agents and data analysts . players clubs and representatives of more than 80 agencies are gathered to talk transfers .

title: The mercurial backcourt motoring Notre Dame's March Madness
content: the top plays this season are from Hannah Hidalgo, Olivia Miles and Sonia Citron . the trio in the backcourt combined for 61 points, 18 rebounds, 12 assists and 10 steals . last year's WNBA was the second-ranked women's team in the country .

title: 'You have a great PM': Trump praises 'very smart man' Modi amidst trade tensions
content: President Trump praised Prime Minister Modi as a smart leader and great friend while criticizing India's high import tariffs. Trump emphasized progress in trade talks and India's commitment to lower tariffs, significant energy purchases, defense deals, and reduced duties on key imports. These efforts aim to strengthen US-India trade ties amid ongoing friction.

title: Elon Musk sells X platform to his xAI company
content: Elon Musk's xAI has acquired social media platform X in an all-stock deal valuing X at $33 billion. The merger aims to combine xAI's advanced AI capabilities with X's extensive user base to create smarter and more meaningful experiences, highlighting Musk's commitment to truth-seeking AI.

title: Musk to visit CIA next week to discuss govt efficiency: Report
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is set to meet CIA Director John Ratcliffe to discuss governmental efficiency. This follows concerns about Musk's Chinese business interests and the potential risk if he were to receive classified military information amid rising tensions with China.

title: Trump posts new video, promoting US military support for island
content: Donald Trump shares a new video emphasizing America's support for Greenland's security amid his interest in annexing the island. The video highlights historical and contemporary challenges, including threats from Russia and China. Vice President Vance's recent visit to Greenland includes military briefings and strengthens US-Greenland relations, despite Greenland's ongoing ties with Denmark.

title: Muhammad Yunus meets Xi Jinping, gets China's backing for government
content: President Xi Jinping assured China's support to Bangladesh's interim government and pledged to expand economic cooperation in a meeting with chief adviser Muhammad Yunus. Xi promised to encourage Chinese manufacturing enterprises to relocate to Bangladesh, granting duty-free product access. Bangladesh invited Chinese companies for a river project, previously planned with India.

title: Finally it's over! RCB end 17-year losing streak against CSK at Chepauk
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru ended their 17-year drought at MA Chidambaram Stadium by defeating Chennai Super Kings by 50 runs in an IPL 2025 clash. RCB posted a formidable 196/7 with key contributions from Rajat Patidar, Phil Salt and Virat Kohli. Despite MS Dhoni's late efforts, CSK's chase faltered, marking RCB's first win at Chepauk since 2008.

title: Navratri Colours: Here is the list of nine colours and their significance
content: Each day of Chaitra Navratri is associated with a specific colour, which holds significant meaning and symbolism for the nine forms of Goddess Durga.

title: Protesters create ruckus at Mamata Banerjee's keynote talk at Oxford
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's speech at Oxford was disrupted by two groups of protesters, causing chaos. Security had to intervene as protesters accused her of various allegations, with the incident highlighting political tensions and unrest among certain groups.

title: Delhi HC bins government’s order junking academic Swain’s OCI card
content: Delhi high court overturned the government's cancellation of Ashok Swain's OCI card but permitted the issuance of a new show-cause notice with a reasoned order. Swain had contested the revocation, arguing it was executed unfairly and targeted him for his views on the government.

title: SC refuses PIL seeking FIR against Yashwant Varma; government notifies transfer
content: The government has transferred Justice Yashwant Varma from the Delhi High Court to Allahabad High Court amid allegations of cash recovery from his residence. The Supreme Court dismissed a PIL seeking an FIR against him, allowing an in-house inquiry to proceed. An inquiry panel's report is expected soon, while CJI Khanna ensures the investigation adheres to established procedures.

title: Rana Sanga row in Parliament leads to BJP-opposition clash
content: The ongoing debate over Rajput ruler Rana Sanga's historical actions intensified in the Indian Parliament, with BJP condemning SP member Ramji Lal Suman's remarks. The conflict highlights accusations by Samajwadi Party and Congress of BJP targeting Dalit and tribal representatives.

title: Deposit Rs 4 lakh first, then go to Parliament, HC tells Engineer Rashid
content: The Delhi High Court ordered jailed J&K MP Abdul Rashid Sheikh to deposit approximately Rs 4 lakh for travel expenses to attend Parliament. Rashid has already deposited Rs 1.4 lakh and will pay the remainder within three days. The court stressed the importance of fulfilling the constitutional duties despite the high costs.

title: Body of 4th cop sighted at Kathua encounter site; operation still underway
content: Four police personnel have been killed in an ongoing gunfight with suspected Pakistani terrorists in the Sufain forest area of Jammu's Kathua district. The operation, involving the J&K Police's SOG, Army, and CRPF, continues, with a total of five terrorists reportedly neutralized.

title: Kisan netas out of Punjab jails; Dallewal breaks indefinite fast
content: Farm leaders arrested in Punjab over a week ago have been released, and Jagjit Dallewal has ended his indefinite fast. The Supreme Court acknowledged Dallewal as a genuine leader while noting that other elements obstructed resolution efforts. The SC will now consider urging the Centre to address farmers' demands.

title: After killing wife, Techie spoke to body, drank phenyl in suicide attempt
content: Rakesh Rajendra Khedekar confessed to killing his wife, Gouri Anil Sambrekar, after a fight over her job on March 26. Following the murder, he talked to her body all night. He later attempted suicide but survived. Police detained him near Pune and are awaiting medical clearance to present him in court for further investigation.

title: India cannot change fanatical and bigoted mindset of Pakistan: Jaishankar in LS
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar informed the Lok Sabha that India is closely monitoring minority attacks in Pakistan and Bangladesh. He highlighted recent incidents targeting Hindus, Sikhs, Ahmadis, and Christians. Jaishankar stressed India's inability to change Pakistan's mindset but affirmed proactive measures to address the issue. The Human Rights Focus Pakistan report noted a rise in minority attacks in 2025.

title: Will BJP's 'Saugat-e-Modi' trump opposition's iftar outreach in Bihar?
content: Iftar diplomacy has become a critical platform for political maneuvering in Bihar amidst the proposed Waqf Amendment Bill controversy. Key ally leaders, including Nitish Kumar, face pressure from Muslim organizations while parties like RJD capitalise on the situation to garner support. BJP's 'Saugat-e-Modi' campaign aims to mitigate community anger.

title: Bangkok quake: Video captures crane snapping in half, plunging off high-rise
content: A powerful 7.7-magnitude earthquake in Myanmar has caused widespread devastation, toppling buildings and leaving at least 144 dead. The tremors were felt as far as Thailand, where construction sites collapsed, adding to the aftermath's chaos. A state of emergency has been declared as rescue efforts continue.

title: Patidar, Hazlewood power RCB to first Chepauk win since 2008
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) defeated Chennai Super Kings (CSK) by 50 runs in the Indian Premier League match. Rajat Patidar scored a crucial 51 runs while Josh Hazlewood's bowling figures of 3/21 stalled CSK's chase. Despite MS Dhoni's late efforts, CSK finished at 146/8, falling short of the 197-run target.

title: ‘Treasonous’: Suvendu Adhikari urges Jaishankar to ban Mamata’s foreign visits
content: West Bengal opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari urges the external affairs minister to prevent future official foreign visits by CM Mamata Banerjee, accusing her of undermining India during a UK visit. Adhikari condemns her comments as dishonoring freedom fighters and India's economic aspirations.

title: MS Dhoni becomes CSK’s highest run-scorer in IPL history
content: MS Dhoni becomes Chennai Super Kings' highest run-scorer in IPL history with 4699 runs, surpassing Suresh Raina. Despite Dhoni's efforts, CSK could not chase down RCB's 196, managing only 146/8. RCB end their 17-year drought at Chepauk, powered by Rajat Patidar’s 51 and notable contributions from Phil Salt and Virat Kohli.

title: 16 Maoists killed, two jawans injured in encounter in Chhattisgarh’s Sukma
content: The gunfight occurred in a forest under the Kerlapal police station area, where a joint team of security forces was out on an anti-Maoist operation

title: Self-styled pastor Bajinder Singh convicted for rape in 2018 case
content: A self-proclaimed pastor, the 42-year-old claims to cure ailments and other problems by offering miracle services that have often come under criticism; quantum of punishment will be delivered on April 1

title: Bihar Government will confiscate property of Lalu Prasad to recover money swindled from fodder scam: Samrat Choudhary
content: Mr. Choudhary, who also holds the finance portfolio, said the Government will speak to the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and Income Tax department so that Bihar’s money could be brought back to its treasury

title: A heinous crime and a wake up call for Hyderabad’s suburban train services
content: Rape attempt on a woman passenger travelling to Medchal on local train last Saturday (March 22, 2025) lays bare gaping holes in security. Damage control measures by South Central Railway fail to impress commuters, who say it has turned a blind eye to obvious red flags

title: Maharashtra CM releases grant of over ₹25 crore to 560 cowsheds under Desi Govansh Pariposhan Yojana
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister has deposited ₹ 25 crore 44 lakh to 560 cowsheds under Desi Govansh Pariposhan Yojana for the months of January, February and March.

title: Myanmar earthquake: India’s National Centre for Seismology says soil liquefaction caused severe damage
content: Another major reason for the damage was that the earthquake's shaking frequency matched the natural vibration of buildings, making those more vulnerable, the NCS said

title: Coffee Board launches GI-tagged, single-serve drip bags
content: We are planning to sell coffee online to popularise and promote GI-tagged coffee and make them accessible to consumers across the country, says Coffee Board Secretary and CEO K.G. Jagadeesha

title: Protests across Jammu region against killings of cops in Kathua
content: The Congress, the BJP, the Shiv Sena Dogra Front and the Rashtriya Bajrang Dal held protests against Pakistan in various parts of the Jammu belt

title: Chinese electric car maker BYD likely to drive into Telangana with first plant in India
content: It is expected to be a mega project given the expected investment and will also spur growth of an ecosystem of component makers and created thousands of jobs

title: Ranya Rao case: A minefield of gold blows up
content: The alleged gold smuggling case involving Ranya Rao, an actor and the step-daughter of an IPS officer in Karnataka, has sent shock waves through Karnataka. While the Opposition has questioned the ruling Congress over the involvement of politicians, serious concerns have been raised about the security breach at the airport and the abuse of police protocol by the families of officers, reports K.V. Aditya Bharadwaj

title: "Never Differentiated Between Yuvraj And Dhoni": Yograj's Stunning U-Turn
content: Yograj Singh, father of legendary Indian all-rounder, is never shy away from bold statement . he has often commented about MS Dhoni and how his career was hampered by his captaincy . earlier, he had stated that he would "never forgive" his son for shortening his son's career .

title: Over 1,800 contempt cases in Supreme Court, 1.43 lakh across High Courts remain pending: Law Minister
content: The reasons for non-compliance with the orders in contempt cases pending before the Supreme Court and various High Courts are not available with the government, said Arjun Ram Meghwal

title: Delhi HC rejects Centre’s order cancelling OCI card of academic Ashok Swain
content: Academician Swain in his plea filed in 2023 had argued that his mother who lived in India was unwell and he was the only son and hadn’t been able to visit India in the past three years

title: Army inducts in-house developed First Person View drones
content: Indian Army introduces FPV drone with anti-tank payload, developed internally in collaboration with TBRL, marking a tactical warfare milestone

title: One in five parents in India navigate parenting challenges: CBSE survey
content: In line with NEP 2020, CBSE has launched a parenting calendar to better structure parents involvement in students lives

title: Opposition MPs argue for cap on ‘excessive’ airfares, panel to monitor them
content: Opposition leaders seeking a joint meeting with airline operators and relevant stakeholders to regulate airfare cap; a quasi-judicial body will monitor “exploitative” ticket prices during festive season

title: Muslims back AIMPLB call; wear armbands to protest Waqf Bill
content: In Sambhal, in the eye of a storm following recent clashes, several young men responded to the Board’s call by wearing the armbands in Friday prayers

title: Srinagar’s Jama Masjid shut, police book organisers of procession
content: A case was registered against the organisers and participants of a Youm-e-Quds procession in Sonpah village, Beerwah, for creating a law and order situation

title: WoW Awards: The Hindu honours women in diverse fields
content: Women’s appearance in public spaces has become more significant and inevitable today, says Justice R.N. Manjula at the The Hindu World of Women (WoW) Awards 2025

title: Delhi govt. to bring in cow protection law
content: Home Minister makes announcement in Assembly after BJP MLA Ashok Goel cites data on accidents due to stray cows; Mustafabad MLA proposes changing constituency’s name to Shiv Nagar; ruckus after AAP legislators, LoP marshalled out

title: Reconsider building working women’s hostel in varsity grounds, says SPCSS-TN
content: Govt has planned to build a working women’s hostel in varsity’s Ramanujan Institute for Advanced Study in Mathematics

title: Atishi asks BJP to explain source of ₹1-lakh-crore budget
content: “Delhi’s actual revenue will be ₹78,000 crore, not ₹1-lakh-crore, and Chief Minster Rekha Gupta has misled the people of Delhi,” Ms. Atishi said

title: Remove Aurangzeb’s tomb from the list of protected monuments: Shiv Sena
content: The tomb, situated in Khultabad near Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar in Maharashtra, is under the protection of Archaeological Survey of India as a ‘monument of national importance’

title: BPSC Row: Patna High Court dismisses petitions demanding fresh examination
content: Acting Chief Justice of the Patna HC, Ashutosh Kumar, delivered the order directing the Commission shall carry out the Mains Examination, ensuring that the process is peaceful, fair, and transparent

title: Five teams deployed to probe pastor’s death; wife’s statement recorded
content: East Godavari SP deploys five teams to investigate pastor Praveen Kumar’s suspicious death; wife’s statement recorded in Hyderabad

title: Defence Ministry signs ₹62,700-crore contract with HAL to buy 156 light combat helicopters
content: This is India’s first indigenously designed and developed high altitude combat helicopter; plan to achieve indigenous manufacture of 65% of components as well; IAF to lease flight refuelling aircraft

title: Set up committee to help women and children in strife-torn Manipur, panel urges Ministry
content: Take steps to safeguard them from sexual violence in relief camps, educate the displaced children, and provide jobs for the affected women, says parliamentary panel

title: WRD plans to build six check dams across Palar river at cost of ₹30 crore each
content: new check dams in will help in storing excess rainwater during monsoon. Large tracts of farmlands along the river can benefit from uninterrupted irrigation, says a farmer

title: India sends 15 tonnes of relief material to earthquake-hit Myanmar
content: Over 150 people killed as powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake rocks Myanmar, Thailand; destroys buildings, bridge, and dam

title: Air India Express projects 50% passenger growth in FY 2026
content: Airline added 37 aircraft to its fleet, including 12 transferred from Air India; will be adding 15 more in the next fiscal

title: Rahul Gandhi meets bank employees worried about retrenchment and privatisation
content: ICICI employee delegation claims they were dismissed while on medical leave or after raising concerns about management; IDBI workers worried about privatisation despite earlier assurances

title: Even Indira couldn’t change Pakistan’s ‘bigoted mindset’: Jaishankar
content: External Affairs Minister responds to questions in Parliament on minority rights in Bangladesh and Pakistan; he says India has raised issue at international forums or with the government concerned; Islamabad brazenly harbours terrorists, he adds

title: CBI says R.G. Kar case not gang rape, to continue probe on ‘conspiracy, cover-up, evidence destruction’
content: It is worth noting that on January 18 this year the Additional District and Sessions Court, Sealdah convicted Sanjay Roy of the doctor’s rape and murder. On January 20, Mr Roy, a former civic police volunteer, was sentenced to life imprisonment

title: 24-year-old man with rare brain-affecting Sjögren’s Syndrome treated
content: Manipal Hospital, Vijayawada, successfully diagnosed and treated a rare case of Sjögren’s Syndrome affecting the brain, saving a 24-year-old man

title: A.P. govt. allocates ₹600 crore for development of roads
content: Special focus has been put on roads classified under Category-C, which are severely damaged and in need of urgent restoration, says R & B Minister

title: Six students missing from Konaseema, police launch search
content: Six students from Aalamuru in Konaseema district missing since March 24 after parents scolded them. Police seek public help in search efforts

title: Colour discrimination still exists: Chief Secretary
content: Takes part in session on ’ Social justicde in tribal communities’ at Tribal literature festival in KIRTADS

title: Guntur district police to intensify crime prevention measures
content: SP S. Satish Kumar directs strict action on crime in Guntur, enhancing CCTV surveillance, NBW execution, forensic database upgrades, and public safety measures

title: Amid tight security, Friday prayers conducted peacefully across U.P.
content: Director General of Police, Uttar Pradesh Prashant Kumar monitored the security situation from the dedicated control room of State police headquarters

title: Hazardous chemicals detected at high levels in samples collected from Kuzhikandam creek
content: The Kerala State Pollution Control Board had annexed the committee findings in its updated report on the fish kill dated March 24, 2025, filed before the Southern Bench of the National Green Tribunal

title: Rajya Sabha stalled by protests against SP MP’s expunged remarks on Rajput warrior
content: BJP demanded an apology for Ramji Lal Suman’s insult; Opposition protested attack on Mr. Suman’s home by Karni Sena activists; RS chair notes challenge of expunging remarks in the age of social media

title: Telangana Man Falls In Love With 2 Women, Marries Them In Same Ceremony
content: a man married two women at the same time in Telangana's Komaram Bheem Asifabad district . he said he was in love with Lal Devi and Jhalkari Devi and decided to marry them in a single ceremony . the groom even printed the names of both the brides on an invitation card and organised a grand celebration .

title: India, U.S. to hold wrap-up session on Saturday on proposed trade pact; talks in early stages: Sources
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the ongoing talks between India and the U.S. for the proposed pact are progressing "well" and will be for the "good" of both nations while protecting India's interests

title: CPI(M) takes out protest march to ED office in Kochi
content: The march was part of the CPI(M)’s decision to launch a grassroots campaign to expose what it alleged to be the BJP-led Central government’s “brazen politicisation” of the ED

title: KIIT University’s negligence led to Nepal student’s death: NHRC
content: KIIT officials handled the student’s complaint prior to her death in a ‘very casual manner’, and their ‘gross negligence’ may be treated as act of ‘abetment to commit suicide’, says report

title: MMRDA allocated ₹40,187 crore for Infra projects for year 2025-2026
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis called the Mumbai Metropolitan Region as the backbone of Maharashtra’s economic development

title: Residents up in arms against late-night functioning of wayside eateries in Kozhikode
content: They allege that drug peddlers are frequently camping on Kovoor-Iringadanpally route; police to step up night patrol

title: BEML secures fresh order worth ₹405 cr. from BMRCL for metro trainsets
content: The metro trainsets, designed and developed by BEML’s in-house engineering teams in Bengaluru, will feature a six-car driverless configuration.

title: People at Deocha Pachami have a right to say ‘no’ to coal mining project, say activists
content: Activists said that they get a sense of déjà vu reminding them of the Singur and Nandigram protests against forcible land acquisition

title: Mayawati hits out at SP for ‘dirty politics’ on Rana Sanga issue
content: Ramji Lal Suman, a Dalit Rajya Sabha MP from the Samajwadi Party, had made comments which were allegedly derogatory to Rajput icon Rana Sanga

title: BJP rebels decide to appeal to high command to roll back Yatnal’s expulsion
content: Yatnal, who had stayed put in his home town since his expulsion, was also part of meeting held in Bengaluru

title: Chhattisgarh amends property registration law to include ‘child’ in place of ‘son’
content: The basis of the said provision, the draft notes, is to “practically include both sons and daughters”

title: BJP plans outreach events to popularise Central schemes
content: At the first meeting of the party core committee after Rajeev Chandrasekhar took charge as State president, it was decided to set up help desks in all district offices of the party before April 15 to bring Central schemes to the people

title: IIMB 50th convocation: Couples who crossed the finish line together while apart
content: While two of these couples studied in different IIMs across the country, one couple met at IIMB and got married before convocation

title: Class 10 Social Studies examination rescheduled to April 1 in Andhra Pradesh
content: Initially planned to be conducted on March 31, the examination has to be deferred as it has been declared a holiday on that day because of Ramzan

title: A Century of Pavangal: celebrating the impact of Malayalam translation of Les Misérables
content: Pavangal was a work that deeply impacted the collective conscience of Malayalis and became a catalyst for their transformation into global citizens, says Minister

title: Governor refers Mineral Rights and Mineral Bearing Tax Bill for President’s assent
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot says the Bill will have an adverse impact on the laws passed by Parliament and Supreme Court rulings

title: A.P. Health Minister Satya Kumar seeks additional Central funds of ₹259 crore under NHM and other schemes
content: He also seeks additional Central support for tourism development and cancer treatment initiatives in Andhra Pradesh

title: 'Saw skyscrapers shaking': Indian tourists recount Thailand quake horror
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: International students wake up to email asking them to self deport for campus activism
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities.
